geolocation.imgLocation: What is the location of the image?
geolocation.checkOriginalImage: Check the image's information to validate it.
geolocation.readTheFullPost: Read the full post. You can link to the source. Does the location provide a match?
geolocation.useGoogleImages: Use Google Images search and find relevant images to the current one.
geolocation.useGoogleTranslate: Aren't you familiarized with the text language?. Translate it with Google.
geolocation.locateExactPositionDesktop: Locate the exact position of the damage on the map.
geolocation.useSearchbox: Use the search box or drag the flag to point the location.
geolocation.streetview2Desktop: on the map to find the precise location.
geolocation.streetview3Desktop: Visual clues on the picture might help you: signs, landmarks, roadmarks, recognisable buildings, etc.
geolocation.streetview6Desktop: Be as precise as you can.
geolocation.greatPleaseMeasure: Great! Please, measure the precision of the location you've just saved
geolocation.high: High precision: You found the exact location point on the map: building, street number, coordinates of a road or similar precision.
geolocation.medium: Medium precision: You know the image was taken close to your geolocation. It may be an street, road, path or similar.
geolocation.low: Low precision: The precision you have provided it’s in a level of a city, town, district, region, neighbour and so on.
geolocation.finalMsg: Please click on submit to confirm your contribution.
